eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
When the checkbox is checked, the condition `Checked` is verified.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the checkbox.

Checkbox cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Checkbox is hidden
- Checkbox's layer is hidden
- Checkbox is disabled

Checkbox can always be changed by an action.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Checkbox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Checkbox that can be toggled by a left-click or touch.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Checkbox can be toggled by a left-click or touch. 

When the checkbox is checked, the condition `Checked` is TRUE.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the checkbox.

Checkbox cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Checkbox is hidden
- Checkbox's layer is hidden
- Checkbox is disabled

Checkbox can always be changed by an action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Checkbox

events.comment: Fix inputs that create malformed checkboxes
Change shape painter based on properties
Set halo radius, if not specified

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy31, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Ideal for explosions, hit/impacts, earthquake, etc.

Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position:  Shake the X and/or Y position of the camera 
- Angle: Shake the rotation of the camera 
- Zoom: Shake the zoom level of the camera 

Control how the camera shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the camera moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the camera
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each change of the movement of the camera
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Camera is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake the camera on the specified layer using one or more methods of shaking (position, angle, zoom)

eventsFunctions.description: Shake the camera on the specified layer, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, zoom)
eventsFunctions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake camera on _PARAM3_ layer for _PARAM5_ seconds. Use an amplitude of _PARAM1_px on X axis and _PARAM2_px on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM6_ degrees, and zoom amplitude _PARAM7_ percent.  Wait _PARAM8_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM9_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the X axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the Y axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Every "odd" shake, rotate clockwise (this includes the initial shake and can be used for a one shake effect)
Calculate camera zoom displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached or if stop shaking has been requested

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Check if camera is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking
eventsFunctions.sentence: Camera is shaking

eventsFunctions.description: Stop shaking the camera
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking
eventsFunctions.sentence: Stop shaking the camera

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allows handling all events at once instead of one per frame. 

### Usage:
![Screenshot of the way to use the extension](https://i.imgur.com/DkYfM7W.png)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedP2PEventHandling
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allows handling all received P2P events at once instead of one per frame. It is more complex but also potentially more performant.

eventsFunctions.description: Marks the event as handled, to go on to the next.
eventsFunctions.name: DissmissEvent
eventsFunctions.sentence: Dismiss event _PARAM1_ as handled

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Prevents the back button from quitting the game and provides a condition to check when it's pressed (to allow customising its behavior).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds interactions with the back button

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers whenever the player presses the back button

eventsFunctions.sentence: Back button is pressed

events.inlineCode: eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = gdjs.evtTools.back_button.triggered;

eventsFunctions.description:
This simulates the normal action of the back button. 
This action will quit the app when in a mobile app, and go back to the previous page when in a web browser.
eventsFunctions.name: doDefault
eventsFunctions.sentence: Simulate back button press

events.inlineCode: gdjs.evtTools.back_button.triggered = false;

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: This extension adds tools to access the clipboard. It only works on Windows, macOS, Linux and web browsers.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Clipboard
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Expression returning the content of the clipboard.

eventsFunctions.description:
Read the text from the clipboard asynchronously. As this is "asynchronous", this means that the variable won't be immediately filled with the text from the clipboard. Instead, it will be filled a few milliseconds later.

Note also that on some platforms (like on web browsers), the user will be asked for permissions to read from the clipboard.

This only works on Windows, macOS, Linux and web browsers.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Get text from the clipboard (Windows, macOS, Linux, web browser)
eventsFunctions.name: ReadTextCrossPlaform
eventsFunctions.sentence: Read clipboard and store text in _PARAM1_

parameters.description: Callback variable where to store the result
parameters.name: callback

eventsFunctions.description: Read the text from the clipboard (Windows, macOS, Linux only)
eventsFunctions.fullName: Get text from the clipboard (Windows, macOS, Linux)
eventsFunctions.name: ReadText

events.comment: This is here for retrocompatibility. Try to use the asynchronous readTextCrossPlatform action instead.

events.inlineCode:
const electron = runtimeScene.getGame().getRenderer().getElectron();
if (electron && electron.clipboard) eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = electron.clipboard.readText();

eventsFunctions.description: Write the text in the clipboard (Windows, macOS, Linux, web browser only)
eventsFunctions.fullName: Write text to the clipboard (Windows, macOS, Linux, web browser)
eventsFunctions.name: WriteText
eventsFunctions.sentence: Write _PARAM1_ to clipboard
